shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dawit “Psalter” (fols. 3r-182v) I-1) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David” (fols. 3r-140r) I-2) Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 140v-155v) I-3) Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 155v-164r) I-4) Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” (fols. 165ra-177rb) I-5) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “The Gate of Light” (fols. 177rb-182vb)
Additiones 1-3.

originlink.xlink:title: May ʾAnbäsa Däbrä Gännät Kidanä Mǝḥrät / MAKM

locationlink.xlink:title: May ʾAnbäsa Däbrä Gännät Kidanä Mǝḥrät / MAKM

donors.donor: Wälättä Täklä Haymanot ʾAmätä Mikaʾel (possibly two different people: Wälättä Täklä Haymanot and ʾAmätä Mikaʾel) is mentioned as the donor in Additio 3. She and her family members are also mentioned in the supplication formulas, written in a secondary hand, in red, on fols. 10r, 18v, 27r, 38r, 47r, 53v, 63v, 76v, 86r, 92v, 107v, 122r, 125v, 133r, 140r. Names of some other individuals are written below the names of the donor and her family members, in another secondary hand, in black ink.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. has been resewn with modern synthetic green threads. The full leather cover is for the most part missing; remains of turn-ins are visible on the inner side of the back board. Quires A and I have been repaired with white stitches. The sewing of quires IX, XII, XIV-B has been reinforced with overcast (?) white stitches visible below the 4th sewing station. The bottom margin of fol. 165 has been cut out. The upper and bottom margins of fol. 182 have been trimmed. Holes are carefully amended on fols. 23, 165.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards; the leather cover is for the most part missing; remains of turn-ins and textile inlays are visible on the inner side of the back board. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, two close to the head and two close to the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) – V(8/fols. 34v-42v) – VI(8/fols. 43r-50v) – VII(8/fols. 51r-58v) – VIII(10/fols. 59r-68v) – IX(8/fols. 69r-76v) – X(8/fols. 77r-84v) – XI(8/fols. 85r-92v) – XII(8/fols. 93r-100v) – XIII(8/fols. 101r-108v) – XIV(8/fols. 109r-116v) – XV(8/fols. 117r-124v) – XVI(8/fols. 125r-132v) – XVII(8/fols. 133r-140v) – XVIII(8/fols. 141r-148v) – XIX(8/fols. 149r-156v) – XX(8/fols. 157r-164v) – XXI(8/fols. 165r-172v) – XXII(10fols. 173r-182v) – B(1; s.l.: 1, stub before 1/fol. 183r-v).

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data are for fol. 5r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-4, I-5: all data are for fol. 167r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling

margin.info: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data are for fol. 5r.

rulings.ruling: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C; Text I-4, I-5:1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra (St. Mary in Texts I-4, I-5); titles and numbers of the Pss, Canticles and Songs; title and incipit of the daily readings of Text I-4; the names and traditional interpretation of Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; refrains of Texts I-4 and I-5 (written out fully or abbreviated); a few single words in Texts I-4, I-5; elements of the punctuation signs and text dividers; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.
A few lines on the incipit page of Text I-1; a few lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Text I-4.

abbreviations.abbreviation: Text I-4 ሰ፡ ለ፡ ቅ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain: ሠረቀ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 165rb-166ra) እስመ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 166va-168rb) ኵሉ፡ for ኵሉ፡ ትውልድ፡ ያስተበፅዑኪ፡ ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ (fols. 168vb-170ra) ናዓብየኪ፡ for ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። እስመ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ይኵን፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵልነ (fols. 171rb-172vb) ለኪ፡ for ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እመ፡ ብርሃን፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ በስብሐት፡ ወበውዳሴ (fol. 173rb-vb) ተፈሥሒ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ (fols. 174vb-175b) ወበእንተ፡/ወበእንተዝ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 176rb-177ra) Text I-5 The abbreviation stands for the whole refrain: ወበእንተዝ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 178va-182rb)

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Three lines of text are added above the incipit of Ps. 1, fol. 3r. - A short prayer to Christ is written after Ps. 100 in fol. 92v: ትመጽእ: አይ: ጊዜ። ወከመ: ኃዘነ: ትርአይ: ትሔውፀነ: ማእዜ።… - Ps. 118 is not numbered. - The following Pss. are numbered incorrectly: 15 (numbered 10), 87 (numbered 88).

additional.cont: Fol. 1r: List of tributes or register of land parcels (?).
additional.det: The note is written in a mediocre but careful hand. Some parts are illegible due to faded ink. It lists some revenues (mostly honeycombs) from lands followed by the names of individuals who paid them.

additional.cont: Fol. 2r-v: Fragments of the Second and Third Songs of Moses.
additional.det: The songs are written in the main hand. They derive from Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets”.

additional.cont: Fol. 140r: Donation note.
additional.det: The note is written in a mediocre hand with angular letters, in red ink. It is separated from the main text by chains of black and red dots with nine-dot asterisks in between. The note states that Wälättä Täklä Haymanot ʾAmätä Mikaʾel (possibly two persons are meant, Wälättä Täklä Haymanot and ʾAmätä Mikaʾel) bought the Ms. and donated it to the church of Kidane Mǝḥrät May ʾAnbäsa. It also mentions her parents and her spiritual (?) fathers. Two other spiritual (?) fathers are mentioned above the note.

extras.extra: - The title, ዳዊት, is written on the front board with blue paint. - The Psalms are divided into groups of 10 Pss. by means of a chain of red and black dots. - Numerous directives on use of the Pss. for protective and medical purposes are written in the margin and beside the main text, in a fine hand and with smaller letters: fols. 3r, 3v, 4r, 4v, 5r, 5v, 6v, 7v, 9v, 10v. - The scribe reduced the size of his handwriting to accommodate the end of the line: e.g., fols. 4v, 9r, 15r, 52r, 122r, 146v, 149r, 162v. - Part of the line is taken up: fols. 4v, 9v, 13v, 28v, 29v, 32v, 46v, 78v, 87v, 132r, 141v. - Tämälläs-sign, in the shape of a cross, indicating the place where the omitted verse of ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan, written in the upper margin, belongs: fol. 177v l.13. - Many omissions or corrections are written interlineally or as a continuation of the preceding verse: e.g., fols. 8v, 9r, 50r, 96v, 106r, 108r, 109v, 117r, 129r, 131v, 157r, 161r, 168r. - Corrections written over erased words and passages: e.g., fols. 7v, 9r, 9v, 39r, 98v, 142r, 147v. - Erasures: e.g., fols. 26v, 33v, 53r, 69v, 102v, 124r. - Two stamps of the owning institution (?), barely legible: fol. 164v. - Pen trial: fols. 1v, 36r. - Scribbles and doodles: fols. 1r, 1v, 2r, 31v, 32r, 63r, 168v.
